meanings.definition: A device used for lifting heavy objects.
meanings.sent1: Dad used a jack to lift the car for changing the tire.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic brought a jack to raise the engine for repair.
meanings.sent3: The jack made the heavy box seem as light as a feather.
meanings.sent4: With the jack's help, the burden was lifted off their shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The jack's power to lift amazed the onlookers.

meanings.definition: A playing card with a picture of a soldier or servant.
meanings.sent1: In the game, I drew a jack from the deck of cards.
meanings.sent2: The joker, queen, and jack are all face cards in a deck.
meanings.sent3: The jack in the deck looked like a brave knight ready for battle.
meanings.sent4: The jack in my hand seemed to hold the fate of the game.
meanings.sent5: The jack's image on the card was clear and detailed.

meanings.sent1: He tried to jack the wallet from the unsuspecting man.
meanings.sent2: The thief attempted to jack the jewels from the safe.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon tried to jack some snacks from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: She managed to jack a kiss from her crush at the party.
meanings.sent5: The cunning fox planned to jack some eggs from the henhouse.

meanings.sent1: Jack is a common name for boys in many English-speaking countries.
meanings.sent2: My friend's name is Jack, and he is a great soccer player.
meanings.sent3: Jack waved enthusiastically when his name was called at the ceremony.
meanings.sent4: In the story, Jack was the hero who saved the village from disaster.
meanings.sent5: The name Jack has a strong and friendly ring to it.
